data.title: MIT engineers design an aerial microrobot that can fly as fast as a bumblebee
data.description: MIT researchers developed an aerial microrobot that can fly with speed and agility comparable to real insects. The research opens the door to future bug-sized robots that could aid in search-and-rescue missions.
data.site_name: MIT News | Massachusetts Institute of Technology
data.keywords: Yi-Hsuan Hsiao, Andrea Tagliabue, Owen Matteson, kevin chen, Jonathan P. How, Aerial microrobots, Deep learning models, Mechanical pollination
